I eat here at least once a week
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

And its always the same: cheap, fresh, filling. The formula is simple -- a base of either greens, pita, or rice, a protein, choice of three toppings and unlimited other things like spiced onions, mint, lemon. Top with a dressing of your choice. And there it is. A great healthy meal for under $10.

Yummy choices, you decide how they go together

Fresh, local ingredients assembled according to your specifications -- pick a base (pita, salad, broth), add protein (beef, chicken, lamb), and then pick from sauces and extras that include lemon tahini, hummus, rice, tomatoes/onions, etc. etc. Business was very brisk at lunchtime but we never felt rushed. I liked the minimalist decor and commitment to local produce.
Cant get enough of this place!
Such a unique and interesting concept: middle eastern and greek meet chipotle syle production line. eaten there no less than 8 times in so many weeks

I liked this concept because everyone build a dish to suit them. You start with a base - a pita, salad greens, or mini pita etc., then add humus or other spreads, then add protein (chicken, beef, pork etc) and your meal is ready. Think of a Mediterranean Chipolte. There are kids meals (the two-year old with us loved it).
